did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, Financial documents, Photographs, Printed materials, Publications
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Material pertaining to the founding, meetings, worship, and activities of the temple, a congregation in the United Synagogue of Conservative Judaism.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Minutes, account books, lists, financial statements, correspondence, publications and other material pertaining to the founding, meetings, worship, and activities of the temple, a congregation in the United Synagogue of Conservative Judaism. Includes the Temple Beth-El Bulletin. Deeds and documents relating to the building and cemetery, photographs, seals and other items from the Temple are also included.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Temple Beth-El records, #3834. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: The name of the bulletin varies. Some editions missing.
Contains copy of October 29,1978 Mortgage, March 1968 Agreement.
Includes various letters to the editor and articles.
Includes: Iton Ithaca, The Temple Times, The Temple Tribune, The Jewish Theological Society of America News.

did.unittitle: Rules and Regulations for the Cemeteries; including board resolutions, etc.

scopecontent.p: Includes: photos, cemetery deed, plot information, article "The High Cost of Dying" by Ruth Mulvey Harmer, correspondence.

scopecontent.p: Includes: brochures, correspondence, and articles regarding the tercentenary of the American Jewish community.

scopecontent.p: Includes: "Aspects of Rabbinic Theology" by Solomon Schechter and "The Unseen Powerful Force in Life" by Rabbi Bernard Mandelbaum.
Booklets for 1978, 1988, and 2003 anniversaries.

scopecontent.p: Typed by Anne G. Kramer, June 1978, in spiral binding.
Bound notebook, includes financial records and minutes.
Bound notebook, spine is detached, papers inserted into book, drawings on inside covers.
Includes Constitution And Bylaws of Temple Beth-El, various mailings regarding temple policy.
Correspondence sent to Temple Beth-El.
Copies of letters sent to new members of the temple.
Sealable envelope with two plastic rings, opens up to pages with information about several Jewish holidays. Text in Hebrew and English.
Booklet of instructions for craft-making for children, published by the Overseas Youth Department of the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem.
Written by Dvora Lapson.
Illustrated by Sigmund Forst.
Items stored horizontally in box, with one folders and four books.

scopecontent.p: Book in fastened paper binding.

did.unittitle: Congregation Agudis Achim Book of Minutes

scopecontent.p: Bound notebook, includes inserted papers.
Includes Meeting of April 21, 1935, member dues ledger, papers inside cover.
Front and back covers have been detached from spine.
Two papers previously in a larger package; reservation for plots.
Can deaccession.

did.unittitle: Deed - Agoodash Achim to Temple Beth-El, Lakeview Cemetery Plots

scopecontent.p: Includes copy of the deed, memos to Ralph Marvin, and copies of minutes concerning the subject.
List of Cash Donations and Pledges, record of paid contributions.
Includes correspondence, receipts of donations, lists of uncollected and collected pledge donations.
Ledger with names and addresses of contributors, and dates and amounts of donations.

scopecontent.p: Ledger with deposits and withdrawals including specific allocations of voucher money.
Includes 24 prints, 36 negatives.
Includes 33 prints, 19 negatives.
Includes 49 prints, 37 negatives, sales receipt.

did.unittitle: Community Reception and Brunch, Temple Beth-El

scopecontent.p: Photo album, 27 prints.
Box with return address of J.S. Hecht. Includes 19 color slides.
Metal rod with chain, hand with pointer finger (detached); used for reading scripture.
Facsimile scroll of the Book of Psalms on one roller, with fabric cover marked "Psalms of David". One knob at the end of the roller missing. Text in English.
Facsimile scroll of the Story of Esther, includes fabric cover marked "×××××ª ××¡×ª×¨ Story of Esther", stored in cardboard box. Text in Hebrew.

Facsimile scroll of the Story of Esther, includes fabric cover marked "×××××ª ××¡×ª×¨ Story of Esther", stored in cardboard box. Text in Hebrew. Rolled up with flyer for the Matzoh Fund (Text in Hebrew and English) and telegram from Kollel America.
Six stamps of varying sizes; three imprinted with the image of Temple Beth-El, one imprinted with image of a lamp, one with image of a menorah, and one with image of a scroll marked "USY"

Metal pocket seal (two parts which fit together); seal reads "Temple Beth-El of Ithaca, NY, Inc. 1924". Includes instruction guide, leather case, identification labels, "The Sigwalt Notary and Corporation Handbook"; stored in "Official" cardboard box.

did.unittitle: "A Gift from Menorah Chapels...to remember the important celebrations of our faith."

scopecontent.p: Information on the holidays of Rosh Hashana, Yom Kippur, Sukkot, Chanukah, and Passover; Drawings of religious objects.

did.unittitle: The Early History of Temple Beth-El

scopecontent.p: CD Format, return address of Matt Braun.

did.unittitle: Temple Beth-El 75th Anniversary Program, Audio cassette

scopecontent.p: Posters printed with photographs, articles, and other historical documents. Prepared by congregant Matthew Braun, director of the Tompkins County History Center, for the 75th anniversary commemoration event at Temple Beth-El.

did.unittitle: "B'nai B'rith Vocational Service"; B'nai B'rith Commission on Israel, Bulletin for February 1966; A.D.L. Guest Speaker Hersh L. Adlerstein; Hillel at Cornell University, Spring 1966; The ADL Bulletin, September 1965, "Are Europe's Jews in Danger?"; B'nai B'rith Adult Jewish Education "Time For Torah"; Leo N. Levi Memorial Hospital, letter from Fannie B. McLaughlin to Mr. Marvin; photo of B'nai B'rith Building, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.p: Certain items highlighted and connected with arrows.
